description: The school comedy story is set in a junior high school and centers on the original manga's characters such as Eren and Mikasa as they battle with Titans. The spin-off incorporates gags while using Shingeki no Kyojin's story and notable scenes as its basis.
synonyms: Ataque a los Titanes: Junior High
ผ่ามัธยมไททัน
ผ่า! มัธยมไททัน

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Chibi
tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Cute Boys Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around male characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Food
tags.description: Centers around cooking or food appraisal.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Ghost
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a ghost.

tags.name: Band
tags.description: Main cast is a group of musicians.

tags.name: Rock Music
tags.description: Centers on the musical style of rock, not to be applied to anime that use rock in its soundtrack.

node.description:
[Website](https://linked-horizon.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/L_Horizon_info)

Linked Horizon is a group of artists led by the sound creator [Revo](https://anilist.co/staff/196383/).

__[Profile (Legendoor)](http://www.legendoor.com/artist/%E6%A9%98%E9%BA%BB%E7%BE%8E)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/AsamiTachibana)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/achaamiii/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/caffemocha0428)__

A Japanese pianist, composer and arranger affiliated with Legendoor.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yoshihide_ibata)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yoshihide_ibata)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大久保徹)

Affiliated with [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/).

[Official Blog](http://blog.livedoor.jp/isayamahazime/) After graduating from Oita Prefectural Hitarinkou High School, he matriculated in the cartoon design program of the cartoon arts department at Kyushu Designer Gakuin. After graduating, he moved to Tokyo and started drawing his manga works. In 2006, he applied for the Magazine Grand Prix known as MGP promoted by Kodansha Ltd. and his work [Attack on Titan](https://anilist.co/manga/85420/Attack-on-Titan-Volume-0/) was given the "Fine Work" award. Originally, he offered his work to the Weekly Shonen Jump department at Shueisha, where he was advised to modify his style and story to be more suitable for Weekly Shonen Jump. He declined and instead, decided to take it to the Weekly Shonen Magazine department at Kodansha Ltd. In 2008, he applied for the 80th Weekly Shonen Magazine Freshman Manga Award, where his work ["Heart Break One"]( was given the Special Encouragement Award. His other work "orz" was chosen as a selected work in the 81st Weekly Shonen Magazine Freshman Manga Award. In 2009, his first serialized work _[Attack on Titan](https://anilist.co/manga/53390/Attack-on-Titan/)_ appeared in Bessatsu Shonen Magazine, a monthly magazine. It later was awarded the Shonen category of the 35th Kodansha Manga Award in 2011.

**Height:** 167 cm (5'6") 
**Other:** Named his cat "Nyanko-Sensei" 
**Agency:** Aoni

[Profile](https://www.aoni.co.jp/search/kamiya-hiroshi.html)

On January 1st 2025 it was announced that he had gotten married to actress and gravure model Rina Aizawa.

**Awards:**
- 2008-03: Best Supporting Actor, 2nd Annual Seiyuu Awards
- 2009-03: Best Lead Actor and Best Personality, 3rd Annual Seiyuu Awards
- 2012-03: Most Votes Award, 6th Annual Seiyuu Awards
- 2013-03: Most Votes Award, 7th Annual Seiyuu Awards  

Hosts several radio talk shows, including Dear Girl ~Stories~ with Ono Daisuke. In May 2010, he and Miyu Irino formed a Kiramune unit called KAmiYU, and sang the theme song for Mokei Senshi Gunpla Builders Beginning G.  Their first mini-album "link-up" was released on August 3, 2011.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
- Neuvillette in Genshin Impact
- Shou Ronpo in Uchu Sentai Kyuranger
- Madrex in Bakuage Sentai Boonboomger
[Website](https://ameblo.jp/1967monkey)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yoshihide_ibata)

Nishio graduated from Nagoya Designer Academy and started his career at Anime Spot, a subcontracting studio, after being refused in interviews with several animation studios. He debuted as an in-betweener on [Osomatsu-kun](https://anilist.co/anime/9883/) and as a key animator on [Laughing Salesman](https://anilist.co/anime/3077/).

It's on [Yu Yu Hakusho](https://anilist.co/anime/392//) that Nishio came into his own as an animator, developing weighty and realistic movements influenced by [Satoru Utsunomiya](https://anilist.co/staff/101489/). Thanks to the ability demonstrated there, he was chosen to design the characters for [Ninku](https://anilist.co/anime/912/).

After working as character designer and chief animation director on [Jin-Roh](https://anilist.co/anime/570/) he permanently joined Production I.G. where he became known, together with [Hiroyuki Okiura](https://anilist.co/staff/103502/) and [Kazuchika Kise](https://anilist.co/staff/115781/), as "The Three Gods of I.G."

[Masashi Kishimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/96879/) requested for Nishio to be the character designer of the Naruto anime.

In August 2020, he was promoted to company director of Production I.G alongside [Takayuki Gotou](https://anilist.co/staff/103266/Takayuki-Gotou/), a co-founder of the studio.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/m0r1h1r0/)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yoshihide_ibata)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/m0r1h1r0/)
Youko Kogawa is a Japanese producer and planner working at Pony Canyon.
**Tahei Yamanishi** is a Japanese producer and animation planner.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/290765011) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=3782618)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/石川光久)

Co-founder and representative director of [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/). The studio is named after him and [Takayuki Gotou](https://anilist.co/staff/103266/).

Ishikawa acted as executive producer for the anime sequence The Origin of Ren in Kill Bill, and was the producer of the first two [Ghost in the Shell](https://anilist.co/anime/43/) films. In 2005, Ishikawa joined his first joint Japanese-U.S. collaboration, since the opening of the Production I.G branch in Los Angeles, IGPX: Immortal Grand Prix, a joint production with Production I.G and Cartoon Network. Ishikawa has also produced Batman: Gotham Knight, Halo Legends and Dante's Inferno: An Animated Epic.

He also served as an executive at Bee Train from 1997 to 2006.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Sunma47) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/三間雅文)

One of the industry's most prolific sound directors, having worked on more than 300 productions.

After having graduated college, Mima joined Magic Capsule, a sound production company ran by his relative [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062/). In 1986, he debuted as a sound director on [MD Geist](https://anilist.co/anime/1285/MD-Geist/). He left Magic Capsule in 1996, and later joined Techno Sound. In 2004, he became the studio's representative director.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/Revo)

Revo is a Japanese musician and music producer. Presides over [Linked Horizon](https://anilist.co/staff/114960/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/Revo)

Revo is a Japanese musician and music producer. Presides over [Linked Horizon](https://anilist.co/staff/114960/).
__Taeko Hamauzu__ is a Japanese editor.
**Morioka Kenichi** is a Japanese art and set designer, who also does design work.
